info.title: SuperOffice Agent API v1
info.termsOfService: You must be an authorized user to access this API.

post.summary: Loading default values into a new Preference.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code.

parameters.name: SO-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code. Overrides Accept-Language value.

parameters.name: SO-Culture
parameters.description: Number, date formatting in a specified culture (iso2 language) code. Partially overrides SO-Language/Accept-Language value. Ignored if no Language set.

parameters.name: SO-TimeZone
parameters.description: Specify the timezone code that you would like date/time responses converted to.

parameters.name: SO-AppToken
parameters.description: The application token that identifies the partner app. Used when calling Online WebAPI from a server.

post.summary: Save this preference

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Preference

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Optional comma separated list of properties to include in the result. Other fields are then nulled out to reduce payload size: "Name,department,category". Default = show all fields.

parameters.name: SO-AppToken
parameters.description: The application token that identifies the partner app. Used when calling Online WebAPI from a server.

post.summary: Saves the tab order.

post.summary: Save this set of preferences.
post.description:
Note this method DOES NOT look at level/targetId - it only saves on behalf of the CURRENT USER.

parameters.description: Optional comma separated list of properties to include in the result. Other fields are then nulled out to reduce payload size: "Name,department,category". Default = show all fields.

parameters.name: SO-AppToken
parameters.description: The application token that identifies the partner app. Used when calling Online WebAPI from a server.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.Preference.description:
One preference item, which contains a specification (section/key), the raw string value, and the level at which this value was found.
<para />
Carrier object for Preference.
Services for the Preference Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IPreferenceAgent">Preference Agent</see>.

Level.description: Preference level, using the standard enumerated type. Undefined is returned for preferences that do not have a current setting.

Specification.description: Preference specification, consisting of the section name and key name

DisplayValue.description: Display value, populated when asked for. Suitable for binding display-datasource in lists, etc. Formatted using CultureDataFormatter.

DisplayTooltip.description: Display tooltip, populated when asked for. Suitable for binding display-datasource in lists, etc. Formatted using CultureDataFormatter.

DisplayType.description: Display type, populated when asked for.

TargetId.description: The id of the target row. The table it points at is specified by the preference type.

PrefDescId.description: The id of the prefdesc this preference is connected to

TableName.description: For DisplayType=PrefDescValueType.ListTableRef, TableName will contain the name of the table which the value reference to.

UserPreferenceId.description: The id of the user preference

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.PreferenceSpec.description:
Preference specification, consisting of the section name and key name
<para />
Carrier object for PreferenceSpec.
Services for the PreferenceSpec Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IPreferenceAgent">Preference Agent</see>.

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Security.TableRight.description:
Wraps a table right together with an explanatory reason.
Code can indicate why access is restricted.

SuperOffice.CRM.Security.FieldProperty.description: Class holding properties like field length, field type about a field in the carrier.

SuperOffice.CRM.Security.FieldRight.description:
Wraps the field right together with an explanatory reason.
Also adds logical operators to the field rights so that they can be easily combined.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.TabOrder.description:
Carrier object for TabOrder.
Services for the TabOrder Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IPreferenceAgent">Preference Agent</see>.

AssociateId.description: Associate who owns this tab order

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.Preferenc.description: SavePreference: Save this preference
SaveTabOrder: Saves the tab order. The order is saved pr. user.
GetTabOrder: Gets the tab order.
GetPreference: Get a preference by id
SavePreferenceEntity: Saves a complete preference object, on any level and any target. Preference administrator rights are required to use this
DeletePreference: Delete a preference by id
DeletePreferences: Delete some preferences by id
GetPreferenceByName: Get a preference by name
GetPreferenceByNameAndId: Get a preference by name and owner id.
UpdateNetServicesStatus: Update the NetServices preferences with values contained in the content from the Status URL
GetXsrfPaths: Returns paths that XSRF cookies should be set on
SetXsrfPaths: Update the paths that need XSRF cookies

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.PreferenceDescr.description:
Preference description, drives the Preference GUI. Maintenance client - controls all preferences in SuperOffice.
<para />
Carrier object for PreferenceDescription.
Services for the PreferenceDescription Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IPreferenceAgent">Preference Agent</see>.

ValueType.description: 1=number, 2=text, 3=bool, 4=list of values; 5=list table ref; 6=contact ID, 7=Person ID, 8=Project ID, 9=Selection ID

MaxLevel.description: Lowest allowed setting level, set by user, but not lower than sysMaxLevel

SysMaxLevel.description: Lowest allowed setting level, set by SuperOffice

IsBuiltin.description: 1 = This row populated and maintained by SuperOffice

TableName.description: If valueType = 5, then TableName contains the table referenced by the preference

UserDefinedListId.description: Read-only field, If valueType = 5, and TableName is UDList, then UserdefinedLIstId contains the id of the list referenced by the preference

Rank.description: Rank field for ordering sections, and keys within sections

SubGroup.description: Keys that share a value (including NULL) in this field are shown together; a visual spacer is shown between groups

MinLevel.description: The minimum (furthest away from User) level this preference can be set for

MaxValue.description: Max value (if type 1); list table ID (if type 5)

MinValue.description: Min value (if type 1); list extra id (if type 5)

RequiredLicense.description: Licenses the user/installation must have if this reference is to be shown. Comma-separated list of owner.module pairs

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.Preferenc.description: GetFromSectionAndKey: Gets a PreferenceDescription based on the section and key
GetAllFromSection: Gets all PreferenceDescription-items in the specified section
SaveFromSectionAndKey: Update a PreferenceDescription based on the section and key
DeleteFromSectionAndKey: Gets a PreferenceDescription based on the section and key

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.PreferenceDescr.description:
Preference description line, contains information about a single item in a preference description list.
<para />
Carrier object for PreferenceDescriptionLine.
Services for the PreferenceDescriptionLine Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IPreferenceAgent">Preference Agent</see>.

PrefShowValue.description: Descriptive value, multilang-parsed, to put in list

Description.description: Description of preference value, multi-language parsed

IsBuiltin.description: 1 = This row populated and maintained by SuperOffice

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.Preferenc.description: GetPreferenceDescriptionLineFromIdAndValue: Get a preference description line from a prefDesc_id and a prefValue
GetPreferenceDescriptionLinesByPrefDescId: Get all preference description lines from a prefDesc_id
SavePreferenceDescriptionLines: Saves the PreferenceDescriptionLine array in the SuperOffice database
DeletePreferenceDescriptionLines: Delete the PrefDescLines in the SuperOffice database
DeletePrefDescLinesByPrefDescId: Delete the PrefDescLines associated with Preference Description Id in the SuperOffice database
DeletePrefDescLinesByPrefDescIds: Delete the PrefDescLines associated with Preference Description Ids in the SuperOffice database
GetPreferences: Get one or more preferences based on a set of specifications.<br/>The prefDisplayvalue and prefDisplaytooltip are blank (faster processing relative to GetPreferencesWithDisplayValues)
SavePreferences: Save this set of preferences. Note this method DOES NOT look at level/targetId - it only saves on behalf of the CURRENT USER.
GetPreferencesWithDisplayValues: Get one or more preferences based on a set of specifications<br/>The PrefDisplayValue and PrefDisplaytooltip are populated, at some additional processing cost.
SaveTabOrders:
SavePreferenceEntities: Save this set of preferences.

SuperOffice Password.description:
SuperOffice username:password are passed in Base64-encoded. 

You can also pass inn an unencoded ticket 7T:abc== with the HTTP Authenticate header.

SuperId Authentication.description:
SuperOffice SuperId OAuth implicit flow. 
You need to issue a request to the SuperId authorization URL
    https://online.superoffice.com/login/common/oauth/authorize?response_type=token
      &client_id=670734e0-4c5a-11e3-be9e-a171392e81db
      &redirect_uri=https://example.com/spa/

passing in the application id and redirect URL.

SuperId will log the user in, and redirect to the requested redirect URL with a #payload
containing the access token and claims. (The redirect URL must be registered with SuperId in advance)

   https://example.com/spa#access_token=8A%3aCust12227.AXRrCITpPBvQX3UbIohb
      &token_type=bearer
      &state=
      &expires_in=3600
      &ctx=Cust12227
      &netserver_url=https%3a%2f%2fsod.superoffice.com%2fCust12227%2fRemote%2fServices82%2f

You can take the #access_token value and pass it as the Authenticate HTTP header as a BEARER token.

externalDocs.description: The SuperOffice DevNet Community has more documentation, examples, and discussion forums.
